Name: NB4 AML cell line
Cell description: THP-1 is a monocyte isolated from peripheral blood from an acute monocytic leukemia patient. This cell line can be used in immune system disorder research, immunology research, and toxicology research.
Antigen expression: HLA A2, A9, B5, DRw1, DRw2
Applications: 3D cell culture; Immune system disorder research; Immunology; Toxicology

Name: Hodgkin lymphoma (HL) tumor cells
Cell description: N/A
Genes expressed: Hemoglobin; globin (G gamma, A gamma, epsilon, eta and alpha chains); beta-2-microglobulin; glycophorin
Applications: 3D cell culture; Immune system disorder research; Immunology

Name: Human Hepatocellular carcinoma cell line (LH86)
Cell description: N/A

Name: Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs)
Cell description: One vial of Bone Marrow-Derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells; Normal, Human containing a minimum of 1 x 10**6 viable cells (provided).

Name: Inflamed human aortic endothelial cell
Cell description: Normal Primary Human Aortic Endothelial Cells, when grown in Vascular Cell Basal Media supplemented with Endothelial Cell Growth Kit components, provide an ideal cell system to propagate aortic endothelial cells in low serum conditions with or without the addition of human recombinant VEGF.
Morphology: Cobblestone appearance with large dark nuclei; during proliferation, cells are small and evenly sized, display a high mitotic index and show no presence of smooth muscle cells
Antigen expression: On Willebrand Factor VIII positive and smooth muscle ¦Á-actin negative

Name: Prostate cancer cells
Cell description: DU 145 is a cell line with epithelial morphology that was isolated from the brain of a 69-year-old, White, male with prostate cancer. This cell line is suitable as a transfection host.

Name: SK-BR-3 cell
Cell description: SK-BR-3 [SKBR3] cells were isolated in 1970 from pleural effusion cells of a 43-year-old, White, female adenocarcinoma patient with blood type A+ who had been treated with radiation, steroids, cytoxan, and 5-fluorouracil. Use these cells in your breast cancer research.
Antigen expression: Blood Type A; Rh+; HLA A11, Bw22(+/-), B40, B18

Name: Human breast adenocarcinoma (MCF7) cells
Cell description: MCF7 are epithelial cells isolated from the breast tissue of a 69-year-old, White, female patient with metastatic adenocarcinoma. Use these cells in your breast cancer research.
Genes expressed: Insulin-like growth factor binding protein (IGFBP) BP-2; insulin-like growth factor binding protein (IGFBP) BP-4; insulin-like growth factor binding protein (IGFBP) BP-5

Name: NCI-H460 non-small-cell lung cancer cells
Cell description: NCI-H460 [H460] cells were isolated in 1982 from the pleural fluid of a male patient with large cell lung cancer. Use these cells in your cancer and toxicology research.
Applications: 3D cell culture; Cancer research; High-throughput screening; Toxicology

Name: human glioblastoma cell line U118-MG
Cell description: U-118 MG is a cell line exhibiting mixed morphology that was isolated in 1966 from malignant gliomas from a 50-year-old, male with Grade IV glioblastoma.
Antigen expression: Blood Type A, Rh+; HLA Aw24, A28, B12, Bw47

Name: Cells expressing integrin a5b1
Cell description: U-87 MG is a cell line with epithelial morphology that was isolated from malignant gliomas from a male patient, likely with Glioblastoma. Use these cells in your neuroscience and immuno-oncology research.

Name: small-cell lung cancer (SCLC) cell
Cell description: N/A
Antigen expression: myc+; myb+; fes+; fms+; raf+; ras+

Name: KATO III
Cell description: KATO III cells have spherical morphology and were established in vitro from a pleural effusion of a 55-year-old, Asian male stomach cancer patient. Use these cells in cancer research.

Name: HCC cell (HepG2/MDR)
Cell description: Hep G2 [HEPG2] is a cell line exhibiting epithelial-like morphology that was isolated from a hepatocellular carcinoma of a 15-year-old, White, male youth with liver cancer. The cell line was deposited?by the Wistar Institute and is a suitable transfection host. Expression markers include insulin; insulin-like growth factor II (IGF II).
Genes expressed: Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP, alpha fetoprotein); albumin; alpha2 macroglobulin (alpha-2-macroglobulin)
Applications: 3D cell culture; Cancer research; High-throughput screening; Toxicology

Name: Primary serous ovarian cancer (pSOC) cells
Cell description: N/A
Genes expressed: p53; cytokeratin 7 (CK-7) positive; calretinin positive; Wilms' tumor protein (WT) positive; BRCA1 negative

Name: mouse endothelial cells(bEnd.3 [BEND3])
Cell description: bEnd.3 [BEND3] are endothelial cells isolated from brain tissue derived from a mouse with endothelioma. Applications include neuroscience research.
Genes expressed: Von Willebrand factor-; ICAM-1+; VCAM-1+; MAdCAM-1+ ; The expression of Peyer's Patch high endothelial receptor for lymphocytes, the mucosal vascular addressin (MAdCAM-1) and E-selectin can be induced on bEnd

Name: carcinoma cell
Cell description: N/A

Name: PC12 Cells
Cell description: PC-12 is a cell line that was derived from a transplantable rat pheochromocytoma. This cell line can be used in neuroscience and toxicology research.
Applications: 3D cell culture; High-throughput screening; Neuroscience; Toxicology

Name: Mature 3T3-L1 adipocytes (adipose tissue)
Cell description: 3T3-L1 is a fibroblast that was isolated from the embryo of a mouse. This cell line can be used to study the basic cellular mechanisms associated with diabetes, obesity, and related disorders.

Name: AML cell line (HL60)
Cell description: HL-60 cells are promyeoloblasts isolated from the peripheral blood by leukopheresis from a 36-year-old, Caucasian female with acute promyelocytic leukemia. This cell line can be used in immune disorder and immunology research.
Genes expressed: Tumor necrosis factor (TNF), also known as tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha, TNF alpha), after stimulation with phorbol myristic acid; myc+
Applications: 3D cell culture; Immune system disorder research; Immunology

Name: Hela cells
Cell description: HeLa cells are the first immortal human cells to be grown in culture and the basis for countless significant scientific discoveries. They were isolated in 1951 from a cervical carcinoma derived from a 31-year-old patient.
Genes expressed: Lysophosphatidylcholine (lyso-PC) induces AP-1 activity and c-jun N-terminal kinase activity (JNK1) by a protein kinase C-independent pathway; keratin positive by immunoperoxidase staining

Name: Ramos Cells (B-cell lymphoma cell line)
Cell description: These CCRF-CEM human T lymphoblasts are isolated from the peripheral blood of a female, Caucasian 4 year old with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). The cell line can be used for immuno-oncology and immunology research. It is also a suitable transfection host.
Applications: 3D cell culture; Immune system disorder research; Immunology; Immuno-oncology

Name: Enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli O157:H7 (E. coli O157:H7)
Cell description: A kit containing reporter-labeled Escherichia coli designed to distinguish control strain cross-contamination from true contamination in test samples. This product is appropriate for use as a positive control in quality control assays for E. coli.
Applications: Assay development; Food testing; High-throughput screening

Name: 4T1
Cell description: The tumor growth and metastatic spread of 4T1 cells in BALB/c mice very closely mimic human breast cancer. This tumor-derived cell line is an animal model for stage IV human breast cancer. 4T1-induced tumors can be used as a post-operative model as well as a nonsurgical model because the 4T1-induced tumor metastasizes spontaneously in both models with similar kinetics.
Disease: Mimics human breast cancer; Stage IV

Name: Hep 3B2.1-7 [Hep 3B, Hep-3B, Hep3B]
Cell description: Hep 3B2.1-7[Hep 3B, Hep-3B, Hep3B] is a cell line exhibiting epithelial morphology that was isolated from liver tissue derived from an 8-year-old, Black youth with liver cancer. This cell line contains an integrated hepatitis B virus genome.
Applications: 3D cell culture; Cancer research; High-throughput screening; Infectious disease research; Sexually transmitted disease research; Toxicology
